meanings.definition: Experience or be subjected to something bad or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: I suffer from a headache after staring at the screen for too long.
meanings.sent2: She doesn't want to suffer through another boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to suffer greatly when forced to wear a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The old tree continues to suffer from the harsh winter winds.
meanings.sent5: The children could see the animals suffer in the hot sun at the zoo.

meanings.sent1: He suffers from a toothache and needs to see a dentist.
meanings.sent2: The injured puppy whimpered in pain, suffering from a broken leg.
meanings.sent3: The character in the movie always seems to suffer comically whenever he tries to cook.
meanings.sent4: The town's economy continues to suffer, causing distress to its residents.
meanings.sent5: The hiker could feel his muscles suffer after climbing the steep mountain.

meanings.sent1: I will suffer you to enter the secret garden if you promise not to tell anyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to suffer the students to use their phones during the break.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf suffered the children to find the hidden treasure in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The king would suffer no one to challenge his authority in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The strict librarian would not suffer any noise in the reading room.
